hydration_guidelines.daily_water_intake: Approximately 2-3 Liters (Adjust based on activity level and climate)
hydration_guidelines.timing_strategy: Consume consistently throughout the day. Increase intake during and after workouts.
hydration_guidelines.explanation: Maintaining adequate hydration is crucial for optimal physical performance, nutrient transport, and overall physiological function. Research indicates that even mild dehydration can negatively impact strength and endurance.

adjustment_guidelines.weight_loss_plateau: Increase protein intake by 10-15%, reduce carbohydrate intake by 5-10%, and incorporate high-intensity interval training (HIIT) into your routine.
adjustment_guidelines.strength_plateau: Increase caloric intake by 250-500 calories per day, focusing on complex carbohydrates and lean protein sources. Ensure adequate rest and recovery between workouts.
adjustment_guidelines.energy_issues: Evaluate sleep quality and duration. Consider incorporating a pre-workout supplement containing caffeine and creatine.  If issues persist, consult a healthcare professional to rule out underlying medical conditions.

additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.title: Personalized Nutrition Guidance
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.description: Tailoring dietary recommendations to individual preferences, habits, and current lifestyle, as highlighted in the research, can significantly enhance adherence and effectiveness.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.scientific_basis: Research supports that personalized advice leads to greater improvement in dietary habits and behavior change compared to generic recommendations.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.implementation_strategy: Continuously monitor dietary intake and adjust macronutrient ratios (protein, carbohydrates, fats) based on progress and individual needs. Leverage Nick's preference for chicken and Greek yogurt as primary protein sources.

additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.title: Behavior Change Techniques
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.description: Employing targeted behavior change techniques can facilitate the adoption and maintenance of healthy eating habits.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.scientific_basis: Research emphasizes the importance of tailoring behavior change techniques to the specific needs of the target group for optimal results.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.implementation_strategy: Incorporate self-monitoring of food intake but avoid rigid tracking that could negatively impact psychological well-being. Focus on positive reinforcement and goal setting to maintain motivation.

additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.title: Avoidance of Rigid Self-Monitoring
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.description: While tracking progress is important, overly strict self-monitoring of physique and diet can be detrimental to mental health.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.scientific_basis: Research suggests that rigid self-monitoring can exacerbate eating disorder symptoms and body dissatisfaction.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.implementation_strategy: Focus on overall trends in progress rather than fixating on daily fluctuations. Prioritize subjective measures of well-being and energy levels alongside objective measures like weight and body composition.

additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.title: Sodium and Water Balance
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.description: Pay attention to sodium intake, especially during periods of intense training.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.scientific_basis: Research indicates that disorders of sodium and water balance are common, impacting performance and recovery.
additional_recommendations_based_on_rese.implementation_strategy: Consume electrolyte-rich beverages during and after workouts. Avoid excessive processed foods high in sodium.
